result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter J Riel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
No Contact Provision of bond has been cancelled.
43
of Preliminary Examination - written

11:17 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Dan Muza.  Troy Cross as Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin via video from Columbia County.  Court has received a plea questionaire and waiver of rights.  Atty Cross recites agreement, defendant will waive the peliminary hearing, and information will be filed, and defendant will enter pleas to count 1 & 2 on 2014CF63, count 3 will be dismissed and on 2014CF34 count 1 will be dismissed and counts 2 & 3 will be dismissed and read-in.  Aty Muza concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and probable cause that the felony was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Muza and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to counts 1 & 2 on 2014CF63.  Court orders count 3 on 2014CF63 and Count 1 on 2014CF34 be dismissed and orders counts 2 & 3 on 2014CF34 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing argument by Atty Muza.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: (EACH COUNT)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

court costs $443-Midemeanor count 1 / $518 felony count 2
DNA Sample
AODA assessment and follow-up

Count 2 - 60 days county jail, with huber.  30 days be served beginning upon the agreement of the agent and the other 30 days is to be used for any probation violation.

Court grants 13 days of sentence credit if probation becomes revoked.

Court adjourned at 11:37 a.m.
Waiver of Prelim on March 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Per Melanie in Judge Whites office - notices are to be sent out for waiver of prelim and arraignment on March 18, 2015 at 11:00 a.m. in Green Lake.  Judge will appear via video.

Attorney Muza indicates the defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial. 

DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Muza.  Attorney Muza confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.  Attorney Muza enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

9:14 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $2,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  NO Contact with anyone named in the criminal complaint.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Prelim within 20 days and status of preliminary the week before.

Court adjourned at 9:18 a.m.
